title: Female Afghan students find academic haven in Qatar
summary: Since the Taliban takeover of Kabul in 2021, exile has been the only option for young women wishing to continue their studies. Maryam and Yasaman received scholarships from the American University of Afghanistan, which has relocated in Doha, providing an unexpected opportunity.

title: Unruly Trump threatened with expulsion from civil trial
summary: A jury last year already found that Trump sexually abused writer E. Jean Carroll in 1996 and defamed her when he made a round of denials in October 2022.

title: Macron attacks far-right 'party of lies,' kicking off European elections race
summary: The French president criticized the Rassemblement National's policy 'incoherence' in a press conference on Tuesday. The party headed by Marine Le Pen is currently leading the polls for the June elections.

title: 'The decline in birth rates is a widespread trend across Europe'
summary: While the annual report on French demographics published by France's national statistics institute points to a 6.6% drop in births compared to 2022, demographer Gilles Pison does not consider this decline a cause for concern.

title: US puts back Yemen's Huthis on 'terrorist' entity list
summary: Secretary of State Antony Blinken announced in a statement on Wednesday 'Huthis must be held accountable for their actions.' On the same day, his UK counterpart urged Iran to stop backing the rebels in Yemen.

title: Davos 2024: 'China fancies itself the white dove of world trade'
summary: As an apostle of globalization, which has enshrined Chinese industry in the international supply chain for decades, Beijing will have to adapt to Europe's desire to rebalance trade relations, explains Le Monde's economic columnist Philippe Escande.

title: 'The Global South is challenging a collective memory dominated by the Holocaust and confronting it with colonization'
summary: The hearings of South Africa's case accusing Israel of genocide before the International Court of Justice illustrate the emergence of the Global South and its challenge to the order installed by the West, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Ecuador: Prosecutor probing TV studio attack killed
summary: Ecuadorean prosecutor Cesar Suarez focused on pursuing organized transnational crime in Guayas province, one of the country's most violent areas – and the site of an on-air attack on a television station last week.

title: NBA Warriors assistant coach dead at 46 after heart attack
summary: The Golden State Warriors had been scheduled to play the Utah Jazz on Wednesday night, a game the NBA postponed. Dejan Milojević died in Salt Lake City, where he was hospitalized Tuesday night after the medical emergency happened during a private team dinner.

title: Montreal's police chief centers his mission around prevention
summary: A year after taking office, Fady Dagher is defending a 'concertation' approach by the police force, emphasizing cooperation with social services as a strategy to proactively prevent the majority of violent incidents.

title: Covid-19: Vaccination has prevented 1.4 million deaths in Europe, reports WHO
summary: The World Health Organization is calling on people at risk of severe forms of the disease to make sure they are up to date with their vaccinations.

title: Benzema sues French minister for defamation over Muslim Brotherhood allegations
summary: French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin said in October that the football star 'has a notorious link' with the Muslim Brotherhood Islamist group.

title: AFCON 2024: Where are all the fans?
summary: Fewer than 37,000 spectators attended the opening match between Côte d'Ivoire and Guinea-Bissau on Saturday, in a 60,000-seat stadium that was expectd to be full.

title: French Parliament committee agrees draft language to protect abortion in Constitution
summary: The Assemblée Nationale's Laws Committee approved a draft that would offer women a 'guaranteed freedom' to end pregnancies.

title: Macron waxes nostalgic as he strives to revive second term
summary: To regain political momentum, the French president announced a series of measures at a press conference Tuesday, focusing notably on education and a 'demographic rearmament' strategy.

title: Javier Milei's election in Argentina leaves Peronism in disarray
summary: The far-right libertarian's November 2023 victory has confirmed the deep cracks in Peronism – a once-powerful Argentine political movement. Now, seen as left or center-left, it may hope to regain strength in opposition.

title: Macron promises Ukraine more arms, reaffirms hopes for Gaza ceasefire
summary: The French president said France would send Ukraine 40 long-range SCALP air-to-ground missiles and 'several hundred bombs.'

title: Princess of Wales Kate Middleton hospitalized for up to two weeks after abdominal surgery
summary: The royal was hospitalized after undergoing the planned surgery. Kensington Palace said she is set to return to public duties in April.

title: Three Paris 2024 Olympics sites running behind schedule
summary: The sites are still expected to finish in time for the Games set to take place from July 26 to August 11, said the Games' top infrastructure official.

title: Winter weather heavily disrupts transport in Scandinavia and Germany
summary: Contacted by AFP, a Frankfurt airport spokeswoman said 570 of 1,047 flights had already been axed from the schedule as Germany's business capital prepares for dramatic weather conditions.

title: Macron looks to boost growth and liberalize France's labor market, again
summary: The president wants to make it a priority to simplify administrative processes for businesses. He's also looking to tighten unemployment compensation rules.

title: At Paris' Louvre Museum, the increase in the price of admission does not seem to deter foreign visitors
summary: Since January 15, art lovers have had to pay €22 to push the Pyramid doors, a 30% increase in ticket prices.

title: UK's Rwanda migrant bill clears House of Commons
summary: Rishi Sunak, in power since October 2022, has staked his political future on the scheme, as Britain gears up for its next general election later this year.

title: Greeks outraged over price of baby formula, the most expensive in Europe
summary: According to the Hellenic Competition Commission, Greek parents are paying very high prices for powder baby formula – an average of €27 for 800 grams, compared with €14 in France.

title: Netflix's 'Emily in Paris' and 'Lupin' drive tourism, says French film center
summary: Four out of five foreign tourists to the French capital got an urge to visit after seeing a movie or TV series filmed in the city, according to a new study by France's national cinema body.

title: France and US take head of coalition to strengthen Ukraine's artillery
summary: France will deliver another six Caesar howitzers to Ukraine, and said that 72 more would be produced this year.

title: 'Demographic rearmament': Macron plans to reform parental leave and fight infertility
summary: The French president promised a new, better-paid 'childbirth leave' that would replace the current parental leave system, which fewer people are using.

title: Gazan civilians arrested by Israel share torment of disappearances, humiliations and torture
summary: Residents of neighborhoods occupied by Israeli troops are subjected to mass arrest campaigns. Those who have been released say that beatings, bullying and degrading treatment are the norm.

title: French police protest for extra pay during Paris Olympics
summary: Several police unions urged officers to protest for a €2,000 bonus linked to the security needs of the Paris Olympic Games in July and August. French authorities have made deals with other unions, who are using the games as leverage in their negotiations.

title: For lawyer Rima Hassan, Palestine is the beat of her heart
summary: Threatened with death after speaking out following the Hamas attacks of October 7, the 31-year-old French-Palestinian lawyer left France for Syria, where she was born, and Jordan, where she is preparing a book on her commitment to Palestine.

title: Football: Bastia docked point over fan's racist abuse
summary: The Corsican football club was sanctioned with a one-point deduction, taking the score to 0-0, after a match was interrupted when a fan racially abused an assistant referee.

title: Russians are fed up with heating blackouts and local authorities' inaction
summary: In the suburbs of Moscow and across Russia, multiple accidents on the heating networks are plunging households into the winter cold. Residents blame local authorities for long-standing infrastructure problems and under-investment.

title: The letters from two Ukrainian sisters: 'Since January 6, I've had no news of a school friend fighting at the front'
summary: Olga and Sasha Kurovska, two Ukrainian sisters, one of whom lives in Paris and the other in Kyiv, kept a diary for a year in Le Monde. The pair shared a personal account of how their daily lives were disrupted by the war. They now give updates about their lives in the form of regular correspondence.

title: Report claims French far-right leader Bardella had racist Twitter account
summary: A television report on the young chairman of the far-right Rassemblement National will be broadcast fully, even though the party said that it had appointed bailiffs to block a segment relating to the anonymous Twitter account allegedly used by Jordan Bardella.

title: 'Oppenheimer' tops BAFTA nominations
summary: The French film 'Anatomy of a Fall' also garnered seven BAFTA nominations. The British film awards are taking place on February 18.

title: Russian man sentenced to eight years for draft office arson plot
summary: Maxim Asriyan admitted he brought a Molotov cocktail to the building but says he changed his mind as he didn't want to hurt people working there.

title: Le Monde Group publishes its carbon footprint
summary: The press group's carbon footprint fell sharply in 2022 when compared with 2019, using the same metrics. The use of electronic devices to read the newspaper accounts for almost 40% of the total greenhouse gas emissions.

title: French education minister recuses herself from affairs concerning kids' private school
summary: In a report, inspectors flagged unlawful practices at the elitist Catholic school Stanislas, which was put in the spotlight following Amélie Oudéa-Castéra's appointment at the Education Ministry.

title: Video investigation: Israel's mistreatment of Palestinians detained in Gaza
summary: Multiple videos showing Palestinians stripped in the street were shared on social media. Le Monde analyzed these videos, revealing the Israeli army's degrading practices against Palestinian prisoners.

title: Netanyahu says he opposes Palestinian state in any postwar scenario
summary: The Israeli prime minister also vowed to press ahead with the military offensive in Gaza until Israel achieves 'a decisive victory over Hamas.'

title: US Justice Department finds 'cascading failures' in police response to Uvalde school shooting
summary: Nineteen young children and two teachers were killed when a teenage gunman went on a rampage at Robb Elementary School in May 2022 in America's worst school shooting in a decade.

title: Paris pop-up 'rave' boutique opens its doors
summary: Nicolas Di Felice, artistic director of Courrèges fashion house and an avid electronic music fan, has teamed up with Dizonord record store to open a pop-up boutique in Paris's trendy Marais district – until February 25.
